title: Illuminated Manuscript, Horae Beatea Mariae Virginies, secundum usum Romanae Curiae / Holy Hours of the Virgin Mary, according to the Ritual of the Roman Curie, 1470–80
title_raw: Horae Beatea Mariae Virginies, secundum usum Romanae Curiae / Holy Hours of the Virgin Mary, according to the Ritual of the Roman Curie
medium: pen and ink, brush and washes, gold on parchment. bound in red cover of morocco leather
description:
Manuscript is ruled with 12 large miniatures, 14 pages with large initials in gold and colors and borders of floral designs and hundres of small initials in gold and colors.  The miniatures have partly an ornamental background, partly scenery backgrounds. Like the first pages of the different chapters, the miniatures are bordered with floral designs in gold and colors.
The miniatures represent the following subjects:
The Annunciation.
The Visitation of Mary.
The Nativity of Christ.
Christ's Presentation in the Temple.
The Holy Magies.
The Murder of the Children of Bethlehem.
The Flight to Egypt.
Mary in Adoration before Christ Enthroned (depicted in the background is an angel sounding a trumpet and a beheaded devil in his fall - an unusual iconographic representation).
The Decent of the Holy Ghost (Pentecost).
Mary Enthroned with the Infant Jesus, and Angels in the Act of Offering Sacrifices.
The Last Judgment.
Toten cum (Prayers for the Dead).

tombstone.epitaph: Illuminated Manuscript, Horae Beatea Mariae Virginies, secundum usum Romanae Curiae / Holy Hours of the Virgin Mary, according to the Ritual of the Roman Curie, 1470–80; France; pen and ink, brush and washes, gold on parchment. bound in red cover of morocco leather; 1962-12-1
